comments.text:
how did Eddie play all these parts when they were all talking at the same 
time﻿
comments.author: Brendon00000

comments.text:
+GooglFascists Actually Eddie explained it in Inside the actors studio. For 
a full scene with the entire family at dinner, he would place Tennis Balls 
on sticks and raise them at head level. Placing one of them at a time on 
each spot where each member of the family sit in. He would then dress up as 
one of them at a time and look at each tennis ball stick as if he were 
looking at Cletus or Granny and say the lines he's supposed to say, then 
finish the pattern until all klumps are accounted for. Each individual 
scene was then put into the computer and with the effects software they had 
at the time and simply cut and paste each one and edit it so the timing was 
right between them. In the first movie whenever one was talking to the 
other and both had to be present, a body double was used whenever one's 
face had to not be shown. The only thing I don't know is how the hell they 
managed to pass food to one and other in the scenes where all faces were 
shown.
comments.author: Shanethefilmmaker

comments.text:
Took a lot of work and a lot of scenes. Eddie played Mama Klump, Grandma,
Cletus Klump, Ernie and Sherman but if you notice when one of them is
talking into the camera they just show the back of the heads of the others,
or they shot a scene then blended it with others so it looked like everybody
was together. INGENIOUS, and outrageously FUNNY. A true classic!
